executive_summary: Volatile shifts in consumer demand and market conditions have hurt the Essential Oil Manufacturing industry's expansion through the end of 2023. Essential oils have seen a revival in their popularity amid a growing consumer shift to natural, eco-friendly alternatives of everyday products, aiding industry revenue. However, falling disposable income in the year marked by rising inflationary pressures, along with decreasing demand from cosmetic and beauty products manufacturers, have dampened industry demand. Similarly, the rising costs that come with manufacturers, which include having a consistent line of workers and many machineries to process these plant extracts, have continually pressured profit. Revenue is set to decrease at a CAGR of 2.1% through the end of 2023 to $1.3 billion, including a projected 2.6% increase in 2023 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The appeal of essential oils comes in the form of the scents they evoke from certain flowers and fruits, which helps serve as an aromatic backdrop for households or businesses. Consumers have also acquired these products to alleviate symptoms such as stress or anxiety as a form of aromatherapy, though no research has proven these effects. Essential oils are luxury items, meaning that as consumers have more income to spend, they can affordably buy these products at a higher amount. Growing consumer interest in eco-friendly goods has helped increased demand for products made from sustainable materials.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand Slowed as Economic Conditions Worsened
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Cosmetic and fragrance manufacturers purchase essential oils because of their pleasant scents and sustainable nature.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Manufacturers are expected to continue growing in traditional markets for essential oils while expanding further into new markets amid changing consumer demands. Downstream manufacturers are expected to push more for sustainable products in their operations, which includes the input materials they use in manufacturing them. Since essential oils are derived from plant-based materials, demand among downstream markets is expected to increase during the outlook period. Naturally derived essentials are expected to remain highly valuable ingredients in cosmetics, primarily among a higher number of health-conscious consumers during the outlook period.

More companies are expected to continue to invest, research and develop new essential oils with marketed curative properties, as these oils are purported to relieve various ailments like nausea, headaches and skin issues. Manufacturers are expected to enter the homeopathic market and produce therapeutic-grade essential oils used for aromatherapy purposes is expected to be the largest driver of growth in this area. The success of this segment will likely be determined by future research studies that can scientifically link health benefits to essential oil use. As more consumers increasingly use essential oils for health purposes, industry manufacturers can expect more stringent regulations regarding the claims of purported health benefits.

Increasing regulation from the FDA threatens overall potential industry growth moving forward, particularly for companies that make health claims about their products. Any claims made by manufacturers regarding the health benefits of their products must be approved by the FDA before the product can be sold. Increasing regulation has raised costs for manufacturers in these markets as these companies must spend to invest in research to validate claims about their products. Since two of the most prominent consumer marketers of essential oils operate as multilevel marketing companies, they have also incurred substantial costs monitoring the tactics and messaging of a decentralized sales force.

At the end of the current period, essential oil imports satisfied a large share of domestic demand, thus, the high saturation of the domestic market is expected to reduce future import growth. An expected decline in the trade-weighted index is set to aid industry exports by pricing them more competitively in international markets, which is expected to hurt the value of imports at the same time. Exports are expected to increasingly become a larger portion of revenue in the outlook period, aiding industry revenue. With more establishments expected to open through the end of 2028, manufacturers are expected to raise their demand for more workers.

industry_definition: The Essential Oil Manufacturing industry develops and produces concentrated hydrophobic liquids that contain aroma compounds from plants. An oil is essential in the sense that it carries a distinctive scent or

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Per capita disposable income
threats: Low Outlier Growth: Demand from cosmetic and beauty products manufacturing

key_trends: COVID-19 heavily disrupted the industry. Considered a luxury good, essential oil manufacturers found it difficult to continue to operate and move existing products.
Consumer trends toward sustainability promise to expand the industry. Manufacturers have heavily invested in new formulas to produce more eco-friendly goods, often at a lower cost.
The industry is moderately regulated. The industry is beholden to various federal, state and local regulations and environmental laws that govern the discharge of materials into the environment.
The industry receives no direct assistance from the government. However, tariffs on imported oils aid domestic manufacturers in the sale of their products.
Natural oils are the most popular product offered by the industry. These manufacturers can capitalize on the use of buzzwords like organic, all-natural and plant-based to drive sales.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Essential oils are intermediary goods primarily used in the production of cleaning compounds and cosmetic products, including soaps and fragrances.

products_and_services.product_description: Unlike natural oils, synthetic essential oils are manufactured in a laboratory to mimic the aromas of the plants from which they are derived. Synthetic options appeal to end users since they are more available at lower price points since are less expensive to manufacture than their natural counterparts. Since these options are a fraction of the cost of natural essential oils, many manufacturers opt for synthetic oil blends to reduce purchase costs. Still, evidence strongly suggests these oils do not offer any potential health benefits and could pose significant health risks.

Natural essential oils are chemical compounds derived directly from plants. More people using aromatherapy and a growing demand for natural alternatives to everyday purchases, such as detergents, soaps and candles, has energized this segment. More cosmetics companies have increasingly used essentials in skincare and makeup products to provide a natural marketing image to more health-conscious consumers.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Since essential oils are used in many discretionary beauty products, sales of industry goods typically reflect the level of consumers' disposable income.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Domestic buyers of essentials rely on international markets to purchase essential oils because they are plant-derived and certain materials are limited to specific regions and climates. Some manufacturers have expanded operations abroad to produce essential oils with more unique plants and to have localized access to these plants regularly.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Major Exporters to the United States
international_trade_points.trade_description: India is a major exporter of essential oils, second only to the US. India is the single-largest exporter of essential oils to the United States. Mexico is the second-largest exporter to the United States.
Export markets are highly fragmented since US producers are limited in the essential oils they can naturally produce.
India has largely benefited from new emerging trends in aromas and fragrances since the country is a major supplier of essential oils.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is popular among manufacturers because of its proximity to major markets and well-developed transportation infrastructure. This includes highways, airports and ports, making it easy for manufacturers to reach markets. Florida is a major trade hub. Its access to both the Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf of Mexico makes it a strategic location for international trade. The Southeast's high population concentration attracts companies looking for low-wage labor.

The Great Lakes region is the historic manufacturing backbone of the United States. Key upstream and downstream markets are located in the region. The Great Lakes houses many key chemical and resin manufacturers.
The West is home to many downstream markets and controls international trade with Pacific countries, as well as the United States' neighbors Mexico and Canada.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) does not directly oversee the production of essential oils. However, the FDA does have oversight over the use of essential oils in other manufactured goods.

The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) labels the composition of essential oils with individual identification, in addition to providing requirements for safe labeling, marking and transporting.
Other governmental agencies shape policies that could affect the industry.
The usage of essential oils as homeopathic remedies for common health conditions has been increasingly researched by leading medical organizations.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Companies entering the industry require a workforce that is specialized in essential oil production.

basis_points.basis_description: Since the industry is highly fragmented, downstream markets have their pick of the litter in choosing a manufacturer to supply them.

basis_points.basis_title: Research and development of new products
basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers vie to create desired oils and scents at competitive price points.

concentration_points.concentration_title: No company has over 5% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: No single company has a market share over 5.0%.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Increasing concentration due to brand establishment
concentration_points.concentration_description: The level of concentration within the industry has been marginally increasing as companies establish their brand names.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Expected to remain low concentration long-term
concentration_points.concentration_description: Although these manufacturers have increased their market share, the overall level of concentration is expected to remain low in the long term.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the industry's largest expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, purchase expenses are expected to account for 49.4% of industry revenue. Essential oil manufacturers purchase a variety of inputs, including plants and fruits, to produce essential oils.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages have grown because of necessary skilled labor
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry wages are expected to account for an estimated 14.2% of industry revenue in 2023.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit has shrunk because of rising wages
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry profit is expected to account for 5.7% of revenue in 2023, down slightly from 7.2% in 2018.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Companies entering the essential oil production industry require a workforce that is specialized in essential oil production.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Essential oils have historically been used in the manufacturing processes of cosmetics and household products.
Revenue volatility in this period was exacerbated in the current period by the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Natural essential oils are chemical compounds derived directly from plants.
Unlike natural oils, synthetic essential oils are manufactured in a laboratory.
Excess amounts of these materials that manufacturers do not use in their operations are sold off to other downstream markets.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Imports have grown as a share of the domestic market because many essential oils are derived from plants that do not grow in the US climate.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Essential oils are used mainly in food and cosmetic products, which are somewhat nondiscretionary and therefore enjoy relatively stable demand.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to important suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Access to raw materials, such as lavender and other aromatic plants, is an important consideration when setting up an industry manufacturing operation.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: One of the industry's research focuses has been establishing therapeutic benefits for essential oils, which thus far have not been well researched.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs have risen, but remain relatively low due to heavy automation in oil extraction and bottling.

FAQs.question: What steps does your company take to ensure that it is safeguarding proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: One important proprietary advantage that can be achieved by US-based companies is establishing an exclusive relationship with a foreign producer of raw plants.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Claims by industry companies that their products cure diseases such as cancer and ebola have led to more regulatory scrutiny and higher compliance costs.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: An important regulatory issue is ensuring that consumers are not misled by sales partners regarding the therapeutic benefits of essential oils, which have in most cases not been tested or approved by the FDA.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
What percentage of your company's customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: For operators serving industrial markets, downstream manufacturing customers may represent large portions of revenue, placing great importance on customer retention.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue is derived from exports? Has import penetration affected your operations?
FAQs.answer: As the industry becomes increasingly globalized, it is important for industry operators to function on a global scale to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: What are your relationships with suppliers like? Is there any way you could improve them or enact long-term supply contracts?
FAQs.answer: It is important for industry operators to have close contact with suppliers to reduce the bulk costs of raw materials.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure you comply with federal regulations? What are the associated costs?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators must comply with the Environmental Protection Agency and FDA requirements when manufacturing essential oils.

FAQs.question: Are your products used as inputs in cleaning supplies? What percentage of your revenue is derived from such sales?
FAQs.answer: Essential oils, such as lemon and orange oils, are used in various soap and cleaning compounds.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? How do you create demand when disposable income levels are low?
FAQs.answer: Since essential oils are used in many discretionary beauty products, sales of industry goods typically reflect the level of consumers' disposable income.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your revenue is derived from cosmetic and beauty product manufacturers? Can you branch out into other areas if demand falls?
FAQs.answer: Cosmetic and beauty manufacturers use essential oils in a variety of goods such as skin, hair and body care products.
